intro: Castanopsis yanshanensis, commonly known as the Yanshan tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen leaves and produces small, spiny acorns. It thrives in mountainous regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable but endangered species in its native habitat.
